body.intro: My name is Joe. I'm a Software Developer based in the Midwest.
body.interests: I enjoy all things code, from scripting to application development. My current interests lie in full stack development, modern software architectures and elegant UI designs.
body.education: I completed my undergraduate degree in May of 2019 at Kansas State University earning a B.S. in Computer Science. Prior to that, I attended Butler Community College, earning an A.S. in Mathematics.

education.description: My education at KSU was very broad, challenging, and a lot of fun. The faculty and instructors were an integral in establishing a foundation I still rely on today.
I attended Butler Community College directly after high school. I tried my hand at a few different majors, but found myself in Mathematics.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.summary: Software development, software testing, and product scoping on an HCI Deployment Engine.
jobs.exitStatement: My team was eliminated due to restructuring. While searching for my next position, Iâ€™ve learned React and the common libraries within it's ecosystem. I am eager to leverage my experience toward a challenging new role.

jobs.title: Lead of Development
jobs.summary: Software research and development, IT technical support, and new-hire training.
jobs.exitStatement: I graduated from KSU and landed my first post-grad job as a Software Engineer at NetApp.

jobs.title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant
jobs.summary: Assisted instructors with in-class activities, graded class assignments, and tutored underclassmen on programming in Python.
jobs.exitStatement: I left my position as a TA to accomodate the extra hours needed for my new position as Lead of Development at iTAC.
